com.android.volley.ui

Class PhotoView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.widget.ImageView
        • com.android.volley.ui.NetworkImageView
          • com.android.volley.ui.PhotoView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.GestureDetector.OnDoubleTapListener, android.view.GestureDetector.OnGestureListener, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener, Utils.HorizontallyScrollable

    public class PhotoView
extends NetworkImageView
implements android.view.GestureDetector.OnGestureListener, android.view.GestureDetector.OnDoubleTapListener, android.view.ScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener, Utils.HorizontallyScrollable
    Layout for the photo list view header.

      • setFullScreen

        public void setFullScreen(boolean fullScreen,
                          boolean animate)
        Hides the photo info portion of the header. As a side effect, this automatically enables or disables image transformations [eg zoom, pan, etc...] depending upon the value of fullScreen. If this is not desirable, enable / disable image transformations manually.

      • enableAllowCrop

        public void enableAllowCrop(boolean allowCrop)
        Enable or disable cropping of the displayed image. Cropping can only be enabled before the view has been laid out. Additionally, once cropping has been enabled, it cannot be disabled.

      • getCroppedPhoto

        public android.graphics.Bitmap getCroppedPhoto()
        Gets a bitmap of the cropped region. If cropping is not enabled, returns null.

        Resets the image transformation to its original value.
